definition: to expose/to reveal

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
one word says it all (idiom)/to hit the nail on the head/to be pithy and correct

sentences.english: Xiao Cai sheds light on the realities of pricing at Guanghua Market.
sentences.chinese: 小蔡一語道破光華商家的訂價策略。

sentences.english: Actually I'm a guard against heart is heavy, who also don't believe that.
sentences.chinese: 卻可以一語道破你隱藏着的是個怎樣的人。

sentences.english: But can you hide victims of is a how of person.
sentences.chinese: 卻可以一語道破你隱藏着的是個怎樣的人。

sentences.english: Appreciate Jiang Kejun's candor about use of "low-carbon city."
sentences.chinese: 欣賞姜克雋的直率，一語道破了“低碳城市”的用途。

sentences.english: Wilson captures the dilemma of our era.
sentences.chinese: 一語道破了我們這個時代的困境。

sentences.english: She pointed the important position which designing played in the national development.
sentences.chinese: 一語道破了設計對一個國家發展的重要性。

sentences.english: That every word doth almost tell my name.
sentences.chinese: 每個單詞都道破我名字。

sentences.english: Natural disasters lay bare the best and worst in people, stripping away hubris and artifice.
sentences.chinese: 自然災害道破最好和最差的人們，洗去傲慢和技巧。

sentences.english: It speaks of Rosy flesh and seeded womb.
sentences.chinese: 它道破了玫瑰般肌膚與受孕子宮的祕密。

sentences.english: How much to lay bare the human loneliness.
sentences.chinese: 就道破了人間多少的寂寞。

sentences.english: The real thing in writing, concise and comprehensive word neat.
sentences.chinese: 寫法真實事道破，言簡意賅字利落。

definition: one word says it all (idiom)/to hit the nail on the head/to be pithy and correct
to lay bare in a few words/to expose with a word/to point out bluntly
to see through/disillusioned with/to reject (the world of mortals)
to lay bare (actual facts, secrets etc)/to reveal
to speak/to tell/to voice
to fully grasp/to penetrate
to uncover
see 看破[kan4 po4]
to understand thoroughly/to see beyond the facade/to see through (sb)
to see through something at first glance (idiom)
to point out/to indicate
to point out
to imply/to suggest/to connote/implicit
profound theory (in Daoism and Buddhism)/mysterious principles
overtone (music)/(fig.) connotation/implied meaning
see through (a person, scheme, trick etc)
